parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
______________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.42</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Radio and Chat </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
__________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Enables/disables UI functionality which is responsible for sending text or voice chat to the given chat channel. If the channel was disabled in [[Description.ext]] or [[server.cfg]], it can be enabled with this command, however the UI functionality changes will be local to the PC executing this command.
<template lineStart="1"><title>Informative</title><part><name index="1"/><value>
This command:
* cannot disable Global channel for the admin or server host, because Global channel is always available for the admin
* does not disable ''incoming'' text or voice
* Prior to Arma 3 v2.01.146856 did not interrupt own client's transmission in progress (but prevented any further ones)
* does not affect chat related scripting commands such as [[vehicleChat]], [[globalRadio]] etc.
</value></part></template>

</value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> channelID [[enableChannel]] enable </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> channelID: [[Number]] - [[Channel IDs|channel ID]]</value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> enable: [[Boolean]] - [[true]] to enable, [[false]] to disable (both VoN and chat) </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> channelID [[enableChannel]] [chat, VoN] <template><title>since</title><part><name index="1"/><value>arma3</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.59.135661</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value>y</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> channelID: [[Number]] - [[Channel IDs|channel ID]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER21</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> [chat, VoN]: [[Array]] </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER22</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p23</name>=<value> chat: [[Boolean]] - [[true]] to enable text chat </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER23</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p24</name>=<value> VoN: [[Boolean]] - [[true]] to enable voice chat </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER4</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>0 [[enableChannel]] [[false]]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Disable user ability to send voice and text on global channel</value></part></template></code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>0 [[enableChannel]] [<ext><name>nowiki</name><attr/></ext>[[true]], [[false]]]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>Enable user ability to send text but disable voice on global channel</value></part></template></code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>
